alert.note: Alert for Morris; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 1:28AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Morris and northern Somerset Counties through 200 AM EDT... At 128 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Far Hills, or near Somerville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Somerville, Bridgewater, Dover, Madison, Florham Park, East Hanover, Chatham, Wharton, Rockaway, Morris Plains, Mendham, Mountain Lakes, Peapack And Gladstone, Victory Gardens, Far Hills, Parsippany, Martinsville, Millington and Basking Ridge. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 27 and 39. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 34 and 44. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 15 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
